intro: Adenostemma brasilianum var. triangulare, commonly known as Brazilian adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with five petals. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
